title: [local_auth] More than one user on a device?

labels.name: in triage
labels.description: Presently being triaged by the triage team.

body:
Hi all.

The local_auth plugin only returns a bool that states if the face or finger was correct. How would you use this plugin if you have more than one person using a mobile device and you need to identify who logged in to the app using biometrics? Is there no unique code or id that can be returned to indicate who the user is that authenticated using the plugin? 

If there is some unique code, then it can be mapped to a user table inside the app to find who it is.

title: Partial table cell and border alignment when content size is not known in advance
allow predicate on showTimePicker to have some hours / minutes to be unselectable

labels.name: new feature
labels.description: Nothing broken; request for a new capability.

labels.name: framework
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter repository. See also f: labels.

labels.name: f: material design
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter/material repository.

labels.name: f: date/time picker
labels.description: Date or time picker widgets.

labels.name: proposal
labels.description: A detailed proposal for a change to Flutter

body:
`showTimePicker` could use a predicate to make some hours / minutes unselectable.

For instance you could want to have the time be a multiple of 15 minutes, so 15:15, 15:30, 15:45 are allowed but not 15:57.

title: [IOS]Google Map Widget Shifting Its Camera position while scrolling underneath the SafeArea

labels.name: platform-ios
labels.description: iOS applications specifically.

labels.name: plugin
labels.description: flutter/plugins repository. See also p: labels.

labels.name: p: first party
labels.description: Plugins developed by the Flutter team.

labels.name: p: maps
labels.description: Google Maps plugin.

labels.name: has reproducible steps
labels.description: The issue is ready to work on.

labels.name: found in release: 3.0
labels.description: Found to occur in 3.0

labels.name: found in release: 3.1
labels.description: Found to occur in 3.1

body:
In scrollable widget, when google map come to screen edges, its camera position slightly shifting. And it produces lagging Is there an any way to prevent this behavior. Its like google_map trying to reposition its camera. I think this is like an undesired outcome. How could I keep stable the map while it is at screen edges
Sample code and flutter doctor outputs are below the example gif.

![problem](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69752782/179706532-2fb684d7-12ff-43de-a36e-177bbbb8a895.gif)
Code sample ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; import 'package:google_maps_flutter/google_maps_flutter.dart'; class DenemePage extends StatelessWidget { const DenemePage({Key? key}) : super(key: key); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return SingleChildScrollView( child: Padding( padding: const EdgeInsets.only(top: 200, bottom: 1500), child: Container( width: MediaQuery.of(context).size.width, height: 400, child: Stack( alignment: Alignment.center, children: [ GoogleMap( initialCameraPosition: const CameraPosition(target: LatLng(40, 29), zoom: 10), ), Icon(Icons.radar_outlined) ], ), ), ), ); } } ```
Flutter Doctor ``` [✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.10.3, on macOS 12.4 21F79 darwin-x64, locale tr-TR) • Flutter version 2.10.3 at /Volumes/HARDDISK/SDKs/flutter • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git • Framework revision 7e9793dee1 (5 months ago), 2022-03-02 11:23:12 -0600 • Engine revision bd539267b4 • Dart version 2.16.1 • DevTools version 2.9.2 [✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 31.0.0) • Android SDK at /Volumes/HARDDISK/SDKs/Android/sdk • Platform android-31, build-tools 31.0.0 • Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jre/Contents/Home/bin/java • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.10+0-b96-7281165) • All Android licenses accepted. [✓] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS (Xcode 13.3.1) • Xcode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer • CocoaPods version 1.11.2 [✓] Chrome - develop for the web • Chrome at /Applications/Google Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google Chrome [✓] Android Studio (version 2020.3) • Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents • Flutter plugin can be installed from: 🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter • Dart plugin can be installed from: 🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6351-dart • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.10+0-b96-7281165) [✓] VS Code (version 1.69.1) • VS Code at /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents • Flutter extension version 3.44.0 [✓] Connected device (2 available) • iPhone 13 Pro (mobile) • BE0A3070-5A72-46F4-A649-6C7F17B9A731 • ios • com.apple.CoreSimulator.SimRuntime.iOS-15-4 (simulator) • Chrome (web) • chrome • web-javascript • Google Chrome 103.0.5060.114 [✓] HTTP Host Availability • All required HTTP hosts are available • No issues found! ```

title: Can't find assets with foreign characters

labels.name: in triage
labels.description: Presently being triaged by the triage team.

body:
I can't load assets with special characters.
I can't find any rules on assets naming.
If working as expected, what is the best workaround?

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Add asset กิน.wav to assets folder, also to pubspec.yaml (- assets/กิน.wav)
2. Add `WidgetsFlutterBinding.ensureInitialized();` to main.dart
3. Try to load the asset using
`ByteData bytes = await rootBundle.load('กิน.wav'); //load sound from assets`

**Expected results:** 
Asset is loaded
**Actual results:**
Unable to load asset: กิน.wav

title: Leading digit in Text jumps to start in rtl

labels.name: waiting for customer response
labels.description: The Flutter team cannot make further progress on this issue until the original reporter responds.

labels.name: in triage
labels.description: Presently being triaged by the triage team.

body:
Hi 

I'm not sure if this is in a specification somewhere or a bug.

If you have `Text('19 Jun 2022')`  with an rtl locale like `ar` you will have Jun 2022 19 where in `en` you will have the correct 19 Jun 2022. I understand that there is a lot to say about text directionality when it comes to mixed characters from different languages. But the text I have above does not have mixed characters. Intuitive behavior is for the text to remain the same. I came across this when I had inconsistent `DateFormat`

Thank you all

I had tried a lot of different method from similar issues but none of them works for me, this makes me really confused, when I tried to use `flutter build ipa --verbose`
It comes with an error of
`Command PhaseScriptExecution failed with a nonzero exit code`
and I think it might be caused by this:
`Target release_unpack_ios failed: Exception: Binary`
But I'm not able to find any solution of this.

I've also tried downgrade my flutter version from 3.0.5 to 2.10 and flutter master and Xcode 13 or upgrade to Xcode 14, all those are able to run `flutter run` to build on simulator but none of them are able to run `flutter build ipa`

I've also tried to archive it using Xcode but it shows the same issue of `Command PhaseScriptExecution failed with a nonzero exit code`

Here is my Podfile:
[Podfile.txt](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/9137206/Podfile.txt)

`flutter build ipa --verbose`
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eS4uP5qpwWPSPM8gfMfacJ2qabvuZh4t/view?usp=sharing

Error from archive in Xcode
[xcode_archive.txt](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/9137347/xcode_archive.txt)

any suggestion?
Please help, and Thank you for spending time to understand my issue.

title: Consider avoiding padding the size of the raster cache image if they are just slightly larger than a pixel

labels.name: engine
labels.description: flutter/engine repository. See also e: labels.

labels.name: P4
labels.description: Priority 4 issue (default for bugs, things we're likely to work on)

body:
Consider avoiding padding the size of the cache image when the actual floating point size is not enough larger than an integer to actually capture any rendering past the pixel boundary.

Currently we use the following code to calculate the size of the cache image. But due to the round-off error, the calculated size may be one pixel larger than we expected.
``` c++
  SkRect dest_rect =
      RasterCacheUtil::GetDeviceBounds(context.logical_rect, context.matrix);
  // we always round out here so that the texture is integer sized.
  int width = SkScalarCeilToInt(dest_rect.width());
  int height = SkScalarCeilToInt(dest_rect.height());

  const SkImageInfo image_info = SkImageInfo::MakeN32Premul(
      width, height, sk_ref_sp(context.dst_color_space));
```
c.f. 
https://github.com/flutter/engine/blob/0f83a6fbc4436a0ff7a57de5454ff8229eeb9c1e/flow/raster_cache.cc#L71-L72

here is an example:
the `height` of `dest_rect` is `1890`, but its hex value is `0x1.d88002p+10`, so the `height` of the` image` calculated by `SkScalarCeilToInt(dest_rect.height())` is `1891`
c.f.
https://github.com/flutter/engine/pull/34660#issuecomment-1185270432

## potential solution
Something like "ceil(width - epsilon)" would solve this issue
origin comment
https://github.com/flutter/engine/pull/34660#issuecomment-1185768166

title: ☂️ Remove bitcode support on iOS

labels.name: platform-ios
labels.description: iOS applications specifically.

labels.name: tool
labels.description: Affects the "flutter" command-line tool. See also t: labels.

labels.name: engine
labels.description: flutter/engine repository. See also e: labels.

labels.name: t: xcode
labels.description: "xcodebuild" on iOS and general Xcode project management

body:
Apple is dropping support for bitcode submissions in Xcode 14/iOS 16. Remove it from Flutter.

- [ ] https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/107883
- [ ] https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/107884
- [ ] https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/107886
- [ ] https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/107885
- [ ] https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/107888
- [ ] Remove https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Creating-an-iOS-Bitcode-enabled-app
- [ ] Add note to [add-to-app documentation](https://docs.flutter.dev/development/add-to-app/ios/project-setup) that Flutter no longer supports bitcode, and they need to turn it off in the host app. 

> Starting with Xcode 14, bitcode is no longer required for watchOS and tvOS applications, and the App Store no longer accepts bitcode submissions from Xcode 14.
> 
> Xcode no longer builds bitcode by default and generates a warning message if a project explicitly enables bitcode: “Building with bitcode is deprecated. Please update your project and/or target settings to disable bitcode.” The capability to build with bitcode will be removed in a future Xcode release. IPAs that contain bitcode will have the bitcode stripped before being submitted to the App Store. Debug symbols for past bitcode submissions remain available for download. (86118779)

https://developer.apple.com/documentation/xcode-release-notes/xcode-14-release-notes

Note Apple never used bitcode on macOS so this only impacts iOS.
See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/15288 for breadcrumbs of what needs to be removed.

title: Remove bitcode support from recipes

labels.name: platform-ios
labels.description: iOS applications specifically.

labels.name: engine
labels.description: flutter/engine repository. See also e: labels.

body:
Once bitcode support has been removed from the engine https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/107884, remove `--bitcode` flags from the recipes.  Unify the `ios-release-nobitcode` and `ios-release` artifacts.  May need to publish both for awhile until customers are informed `ios-release-nobitcode` is going away?

> Starting with Xcode 14, bitcode is no longer required for watchOS and tvOS applications, and the App Store no longer accepts bitcode submissions from Xcode 14.

https://flutter.googlesource.com/recipes/+/a3a6b38798fcc6ee99602ef745150ca3555422f8/recipes/engine/engine.py#1399

title: Remove bitcode logic from buildroot

labels.name: platform-ios
labels.description: iOS applications specifically.

labels.name: engine
labels.description: flutter/engine repository. See also e: labels.

body:
Once bitcode support has been removed from the engine https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/107884 and recipes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/107886, remove bitcode logic from buildroot.

https://github.com/flutter/buildroot/blob/fc82ca44f1ae85c5fbfa06bd313477539ca50729/build/toolchain/clang.gni#L22

> Starting with Xcode 14, bitcode is no longer required for watchOS and tvOS applications, and the App Store no longer accepts bitcode submissions from Xcode 14.

See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/15288 and https://github.com/flutter/buildroot/pull/272 when bitcode was introduced.

title: Remove bitcode support from engine

labels.name: platform-ios
labels.description: iOS applications specifically.

labels.name: engine
labels.description: flutter/engine repository. See also e: labels.

body:
Once bitcode support has been removed from Flutter tooling https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/107883, remove `--bitcode` from the gn script and any other relevant logic.

> Starting with Xcode 14, bitcode is no longer required for watchOS and tvOS applications, and the App Store no longer accepts bitcode submissions from Xcode 14.

See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/15288 and https://github.com/flutter/engine/pull/9823 when bitcode was introduced.

title: Remove bitcode support from the flutter tool

labels.name: platform-ios
labels.description: iOS applications specifically.

labels.name: tool
labels.description: Affects the "flutter" command-line tool. See also t: labels.

labels.name: t: xcode
labels.description: "xcodebuild" on iOS and general Xcode project management

body:
Once Xcode 14 is released, remove bitcode from the `flutter` tool and integration tests.

> Starting with Xcode 14, bitcode is no longer required for watchOS and tvOS applications, and the App Store no longer accepts bitcode submissions from Xcode 14.

Remove `-fembed-bitcode` and `-fembed-bitcode-marker` and `bcsymbolmap` logic.
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/dffddf00a22e77122d67f4503efef16a46c18ec2/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/commands/build_ios_framework.dart#L155-L157

We never turned bitcode on by default in our template, so it shouldn't require a migration. https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/73607#issuecomment-760591579

However it may be worth detecting that developers have turned it on (`ENABLE_BITCODE=YES` build setting) in the tool, and give them a warning and instructions for how to remove it.

See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/15288 and https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/36471 when bitcode was introduced.

title: [video_player] Standardize support for "infinite" (live) streams.

labels.name: platform-android
labels.description: Android applications specifically.

labels.name: platform-ios
labels.description: iOS applications specifically.

labels.name: plugin
labels.description: flutter/plugins repository. See also p: labels.

labels.name: p: first party
labels.description: Plugins developed by the Flutter team.

labels.name: p: video_player
labels.description: The Video Player plugin.

labels.name: P4
labels.description: Priority 4 issue (default for bugs, things we're likely to work on)

body:
## Use case

The current implementation for the video player plugin has some problems with live streams (videos with "infinite"/unknown/unset duration).

### Cross-platform TIME_UNSET 

TIME_UNSET is the value used as the "length" of a live video. Its current value [comes from ExoPlayer2](https://github.com/flutter/plugins/blob/28eff0a8c167d146d73d62aa21a7d93d95bc2578/packages/video_player/video_player_android/android/src/main/java/io/flutter/plugins/videoplayer/VideoPlayer.java#L291) directly ([C.TIME_UNSET](https://exoplayer.dev/doc/reference/constant-values.html#com.google.android.exoplayer2.C.TIME_UNSET)). They had [good reasons to pick that value](https://github.com/google/ExoPlayer/commit/1579b68cf63c0c3c2be310ce3c9e8caf933c7a99).

The [same value was reused](https://github.com/flutter/plugins/blob/a9d2381908cf7adf899d0fcec727f9968fbac01e/packages/video_player/video_player_avfoundation/ios/Classes/FLTVideoPlayerPlugin.m#L114-L119) when improving the live video features in the iOS implementation, so both platforms would behave the same.

When the Web platform attempted to reuse that same magic value; it was too "wide" to be represented exactly by JavaScript, so we needed to use [another one](https://github.com/flutter/plugins/pull/6101#issuecomment-1188499016).

* [ ] **Ensure that all the mobile implementations start returning what the web is returning:** `-(2^53) + 2`, or `-9007199254740990`. Note: **this is a breaking change!**

### Provided UI Widgets

`package:video_player` provides a bunch of Widgets that render different parts of the UI of a Video player, like the `_VideoScrubber`, the `VideoProgressIndicator` (and maybe others).

Currently, they all seem to behave as if the `duration` of the video was always finite, and positive. 

* [ ] **Update UI Widgets to support `TIME_UNSET` durations.**

### Player logic

Most of the player logic assumes that the video has a finite duration, and uses the `duration` coming from the video controller to do things like:

* handle the `VideoEventType.completed` event to seek "to the end"
* validate if a video can be `seekTo`'d to a given position (only if `0 < position < duration`)

Finally, 

* [ ] **Check that the player logic handles well `TIME_UNSET` durations.**

title: [go_router] Observe the path change for the analytics

labels.name: in triage
labels.description: Presently being triaged by the triage team.

body:
My app is using GoRouter with [nested navigation on the NavigationBar](https://github.com/KweeksNews/kweeksnews_app/blob/develop/lib/core/widgets/navbar.dart).

To avoid jarring transition, I'm using the [same ValueKey for all of the NavigationBar's MaterialPage](https://github.com/KweeksNews/kweeksnews_app/blob/develop/lib/core/router/root_router.dart).

Now when I'm trying to implement firebase analytics using NavigatorObserver, none of the didPush, didReplace, or didPop method is called when I switched from one NavigationBar destination to other (eg. from Home to Search). I guess this is because the MaterialPage is using a same ValueKey.

So how can I observe the path change for the analytics?

[This is the current implementation (WIP)](https://github.com/KweeksNews/kweeksnews_app/commit/36cee7e7975604ba7872044e0d4b333675dca660).

title: [webview_flutter_web] NavigationDelegate Support

labels.name: new feature
labels.description: Nothing broken; request for a new capability.

labels.name: plugin
labels.description: flutter/plugins repository. See also p: labels.

labels.name: p: first party
labels.description: Plugins developed by the Flutter team.

labels.name: p: webview
labels.description: WebView Plugin.

labels.name: platform-web
labels.description: Web applications specifically

labels.name: proposal
labels.description: A detailed proposal for a change to Flutter

body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Use case
Hello Flutter Devs, I am asking for NavigationDelegate support to the new webview_flutter_web package. It is great that this package exists but it is lacking a crucial feature. I need to be able to use WebViews on Flutter Web. Currently I am investigating other packages but none have NavigationDelegate support
<!--
     Please tell us the problem you are running into that led to you wanting
     a new feature.

     Is your feature request related to a problem? Please give a clear and
     concise description of what the problem is.

     Describe the alternative solutions you've considered. Is there a package
     on pub.dev/flutter that already solves this?
-->

## Proposal
Include support for NavigationDelegate to webview_flutter_web similar to webview_flutter.

<!--
     Briefly but precisely describe what you would like Flutter to be able to do.

     Consider attaching something showing what you are imagining:
      * images
      * videos
      * code samples

     Does this have to be provided by Flutter directly, or can it be provided
     by a package on pub.dev/flutter? If so, maybe consider implementing and
     publishing such a package rather than filing a bug.
-->

title: Fixes issue with sheet reset on rebuild

labels.name: framework
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter repository. See also f: labels.

labels.name: f: scrolling
labels.description: Viewports, list views, slivers, etc.

body:
There was a bug where the sheet would reset to `initialChildSize` on rebuild if the last change to the sheet was programmatic. This PR introduces a test and fix for this behavior.

Fixes: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/101114

Having both `hasDragged` and `hasChanged` feels quite sloppy to me, but they're the only way to produce the developer-expected behavior here (see code comment above where the two are declared).
